DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Atypical Glandular Cell Diagnosis Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of an identifiable class of abnormal cells that come from inside the cervix or from the lining of the uterus. These abnormal cells are found in a small number of Pap smears (a procedure used to detect cervical cancer) and may be a sign of more serious lesions or cancer.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Atypical Glandular Cell Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a diagnosis (the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease from expressed signs and symptoms) of atypical glandular cell (a term used to describe abnormal cells that come from inside the cervix or from the lining of the uterus; these abnormal cells are found in a small number of Pap smears, a procedure used to detect cervical cancer, and may be a sign of more serious lesions or cancer) disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease is any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Updated to add EVS concept preferred name. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: A term used to describe abnormal cells that come from inside the cervix or from the lining of the uterus. These abnormal cells are found in a small number of Pap smears (a procedure used to detect cervical cancer) and may be a sign of more serious lesions or cancer. The term used to be atypical glandular cells of uncertain significance (AGUS).:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: An abnormal endocervical or endometrial cell found in a cervical smear, not further characterized as neoplastic or non-neoplastic. It is often associated with clinically significant uterine lesions.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type related to a specific cells that come from inside the cervix or from the lining of the uterus of the atypical glandular cells of uncertain significance (AGUS).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lesion in which the normally situated glands are partially or completely replaced by atypical cells with malignant characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A lesion in which the normally situated glands are partially or completely replaced by atypical cells with malignant characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term used to describe abnormal cells that come from inside the cervix or from the lining of the uterus. These abnormal cells are found in a small number of Pap smears (a procedure used to detect cervical cancer) and may be a sign of more serious lesions or cancer. The term used to be atypical glandular cells of uncertain significance (AGUS).

Concepts.definition: An abnormal endocervical or endometrial cell found in a cervical smear, not further characterized as neoplastic or non-neoplastic. It is often associated with clinically significant uterine lesions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to GOG for REBOYJ by script Thu Aug 1 14:45:44 EDT 2013

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have cytolog
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have cytologic diagnosis of AGC (AGC, AEC or AEmC) or AIS documented within the last 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: GOG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have cytologic diagnosis of AGC (AGC, AEC or AEmC) or a cytologic/histologic diagnosis of AIS documented within the last 6 months?
